title: Zoe is Anti-fun
body:
Every game I play against {{champion:142}}  is the same. It's just anti fun to deal with Zoe. I will be dodging any game with her now. 

Your supposed to be able to counter her with range, but she just doesn't care once she hits 6. Even before that, she has one of the most annoying CC's. Sure, its a skill shot, but no other skill shot leaves a pool on the ground that does the same thing if she hit you with the sleep. While it's unique, its more frustrating for the enemy team. I have no issue with any of her other skills, but Zoe is just anti fun. Flame me if you will. :shrug:

A Lux Q + Ult will do the same to you as a Zoe Q. Also considering Zoe Only has two real ways to damage you meaningful; Q and passive. Then she SHOULD DO THAT MUCH WITH HER Q. I actually do have experience. Been playing this since season 2, and have played against Zoe quiet a few times as a mid, Also played against her as a marksmen from bot lane. If your dying to Zoe, then you need to step up you mouse clicks and learn to dodge. That simple. Its little different then a blitz Q. Dodge the skill shot. Its not hard.
If she's that simple to beat, she wouldn't be such a high pick/ban champion in recent competitve games in the first place. Plus, why are you hiding behind a level 11 account?

How bad do you actually have to be to get hit by Zoe's Q when you're not asleep? It's a very small  and highly telegraphed projectile. You can have a ping spike of 1000 and still dodge it with no issue. 

Here's a tip for the low elo struggling against her:

Don't stand in your minion wave. She'll have to choose between using Q on creeps for waveclear or using it to harass, and the former will happen more often.

It's by far one of the harder projectiles to dodge.  If all you were worrying about was the projectile out of her hands, then you're right, but standard dodge and bait mechanics don't work against her.  The geometry of her Q (the redirect) completely changes how you move in lane and her passive adds a lot of damage that makes trading even harder.  There are champions that shut her down hard but for your traditional mage character she's a uniquely frustrating champion to play against.

Let me play dumb here for a little bit and ask what part of the above comment you disagree with.

I want to hear your explanation for why the comment is wrong; I don't necessarily disagree with you but I just want you to elaborate.

From what I can gather from the post above, the commenter is saying that Zoe is just like any other burst mage in which she's supposed to be able to unload her damage once she lands a skill shot with CC. He's also saying that since her Q and passive are her only good damage spells, it's OK for her Q to do so much damage.

I like playing Zoe, but I do admit that she has her flaws. One of them is illustrated in this guy's argument, but I want you to explain it. I want to see if you're actually making arguments, or if you are the one running your mouth.

> A Lux Q + Ult will do the same to you as a Zoe Q.

So it's fine for a champ have same dmg with basic ability + ULT, as other champ with just basic ability, with a very low cd?

That's not true though? 

Zoe needs to use her ult to extend her Q's range or the damage is mediocre. 

Hate her all you want but that's a truth about the champion.
her ult is on a very low cd though

But how often does Nid *actually* do that? I've only seen it happen on isolated targets when it was a [presumed] guaranteed kill. 

Zoe kills people out-right if she lands the bubble, but can't run away.
Nid is hard as F to kill, but normally take only 3/4 of their health bar per Q.
But their overall play-style and cooldowns are otherwise comparable.

3/4 of a squishie's health bar, sure if it hits almost maximum range, but let's not forget that nidalee's spear is definitely one of the easier skillshots to dodge, as well as the fact that nidalee's spears don't gain bonus true damage, unlike the E+Q zoe's combo does.

Neither of them will deal much damage from close range. And I already noted Zoe's E+Q combo killing people out-right.
Take away the CC, and Zoe's Q isn't that much harder to dodge. From my experience so far, the hit-bix is rather small; though the damage is an AoE (for some reason).

The problem isn't with CC. If she has CC in her kit, fine. Vel has it, lux has it, orianna has it. The problem is that none of them even come close in terms of safety when compared to post 6 zoe. It's her damage that she becomes capable of with 3 abilities once she hits level 6. Overall, besides her Q damage + true damage with E proc, she's not OP, her kit is just extremely annoying, and her E skillshot from fog doesn't feel fair, especially when compared to something like veigar's E or even Zac's launch.

To be fair, one of Zoe's "counters", Lux, can do a lot of things that Zoe does. Q out of the fog of war and ult, and mid game, you should be easily able to delete a squishy. But Lux isn't very mobile. Her only defenses are summon spells (Flash, Exhaust, Barrier) and her W. If she can't kite you, she's dead.

Zoe? Chase her, she'll turn on you. Bring friends? Paddleboard poke. Wanna dodge a global ult? Use your short cd ult. Zoe is like a mobile Lux- a safer lux. Its just anti fun to deal with.
